subject: Re: [junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?
msgSnippet: Version 4.1 didn t but the just released 4.5 does. It automatically generates unit tests for any class you have and also allows you to customize them. Once

Version 4.1 didn't but the just released 4.5 does.
It automatically generat=
es unit tests for any class you have and
also allows you to customize them.=


Once you're happy (or even not so happy) with the test suite you've
creat=
ed, you can right-click it and save them as JUnit testcases.

Regards,

Den=
ilson
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=

  From: Chappell, Simon P 
  To: junit@yahoog=
roups.com

  Subject: RE: [junit] I=
s there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?


  JTest is nice, but I h=
adn't realised that it wrote JUnit code? Are you certain about this?

  Sim=
on

    -----Original Mess=
age-----
    From: andy chang [mailto:andy0126@...]
    Sent: Frida=
y, March 15, 2002 10:25 AM
    To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    Subject: Re: [=
junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?


    Yes, you sho=
uld try Jtest from ParaSoft.  It will automatically generate harness around=
 the class and stub out any external call.  It will also execute the testca=
ses you wrote using Junit and provide you with a coverage analysis.  In add=
ition, it will also generate dynamic test cases for you automatically.  

 =
     ----- Original Message -----
      From: markus baumgartner
      Sent=
: Friday, March 15, 2002 8:16 AM
      To: junit@yahoogroups.com
      Subj=
ect: [junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?


      I'm =
spending a lot of time passing new method into the testclass and write a
  =
    "test_" in front of it (and oftenly forget to do it, too).
      I made=
 a try to automate the creation of stubs for all existing methods of a
    =
  class using the Reflection API (e.g. from myProcedure(int A, String B) to=

      test_myProcedure_int_A_String_B. The final goal would be to have the=
 tool
      comparing the class to the test_class and create stubs for new =
methods
      while leaving the existing ones untouched.

      Before I'm =
going to create it on my own, I wanted to know, if anybody knows
      abou=
t an existing tool, that does the job?

      If it does not exist, is ther=
e a good reason, why this automation wouldn't
      make sense? Sometimes f=
or complex function you may need several testcases,
      but they can be e=
asely created by taking the first stub and append a
      number...
